subject: Alignment for Plux X Throttle + VAM Pro
description_text:
Hi there

I am trying to attach the VAM Pro to my Plus X throttle pedal. However, the
screw spacing does not align to allow for two of the screws.

This is for the top of the pedal. The holes in the pedal face do not align
with the spacing on the plate inside the pedal. At the highest position, it
overlaps the bottom hole. The opposite is true at the lowest position.

There is no central position where both holes line up.

I have tried to take photos using telephoto lens to minimise the lens
distortion.



Can you please advise what I am doing wrong?

Brake has no issues.

conversations.body_text: Hi Chanho,   Hello, the VAM Pro on the throttle is designed to be securely fixed with just one screw.

Thank you. There is a little bit of movement using just one screw but it is
not an issue.

If I can provide some feedback, the mounting bracket design is quite
disappointing. Having the motors angled 90° to the pedal creates a lot of
damping, and the motors are too noisy to use beyond 35% strength. There is
a loss of clarity and the noise efficiency is poor - I wish I had better
feedback, but it is too loud.

The design also means you have to attach the bracket to the pedal first,
and then screw in the motors. The 3mm hex key is very weak and difficult to
line up without removing the pedal from the rig entirely.

Trying to screw in the motors with the pedals on the rig, it is very
difficult to line up the 3mm wrench correctly. I worry about stripping the
screws. I feel like a flathead or square wrench design would be more
suitable when it is so small.

A flat plate which you can screw in the motors first, and then a spacer or
standoff which you can use to connect it to the pedal face from the front
would be a lot easier to install and machine, and also provide superior
feedback quality. I will probably attempt to machine or print this myself,
but the original design seems lacking.




I am a big fan of your products. I truly appreicate how quickly you have
iterated the design of your Pro Plus pedals to the Plus X which are
fantastic and unbeatable for the price.

The VAM Pro motors are almost great! A better bracket would greatly improve
the experience.

If there is the option of maybe adding some damping material inside the
linear motor, this could allow you to use higher strength without creating
a jackhammer like noise. It sounds like there is metal-to-metal contact.

A slightly higher frequency change, even 75Hz would also greatly enhance
the ability to use wheel lock up or traction loss effects without requiring
a second bass shaker. I think this could give you an advantage over the
Simagic design if it can be done at a similar price.

I hope you will consider these for your next revision!

Kind regards
Chanho

Hi Chanho,     Hello, and thank you very much for your feedback. We did take many factors into account when designing the bracket, including installation methods similar to Simagic. However, since the front structure of our pedals would otherwise interfere and collide with the motor, we adopted the current design.  In addition, we also recommend using nylon screws and washers, which are very effective in reducing EMI interference from the motor.
